title._content: ["Reveille," Elmer Mulford Crutchfield house, 4200 Cary Street, Richmond, Virginia. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Reveille," Elmer Mulford Crutchfield house, 4200 Cary Street, Richmond, Virginia. Servant's cottage] [1929] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Federal style house built from 1720. Landscape: Circa 1920s, by Elizabeth Patterson Crutchfield, who inherited the house from her father. Today: House, with restored gardens, is on the Register of National Historic Places and preserved by the United Methodist Church. Paper mask is a line grid. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 228. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16344 Call Number: LC-J717-X101- 44
